author: Paul Hannon
title: Global Inflation Stalled in January
text:
Inflation in the worldâ€™s largest economies was unchanged for a third straight month in January, while it fell in rich countries, according to figures released Tuesday by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.
A 2017 pickup in global economic growth that seems set to continue this year has led many investors to expect that inflation will also accelerate, and central banks will tighten policy more rapidly in response. Those concerns have led to rises in bond yields and volatility across other financial markets.
